result.execSummary:
The defendant Montreill A. Lawhorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Montreill A. Lawhorn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Montreill A. Lawhorn was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montreill A. Lawhorn

of Completion
of DNA Collection at Conviction

2:30 PM 
Defendant Montreill A. Lawhorn in court, in custody @ DCI.
 Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Montreill A. Lawhorn.
Attorney Zachary L Brost in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance and victim present in court.
Def. in-custody on another matter.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 2-Misd DC-Dom. Abuse;
Found guilty by the court; Cts 1 & 3 were dismissed outright on State's motion. 
Ct 2:
Defendant sentenced to 5 days in the KCJ with 5 days sentence credit given for time served.
Court costs were waived.
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
$700 cash bond to be applied remainder to poster.
Defendant is eligible for expungement. 
Appeal rights given.

Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. Attorney Knapp appeared for the DE, who did not appear. Clerk/S. Garcia. The DE is in the WSP and was not produced for this hearing.  Writ to be prepared..
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01: PM
Defendant, Montreill A. Lawhorn, appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp.
Attorney Zachary L Brost in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
The 8/3/2022 Hearing has been moved to 8/2/22 at 1:30 pm at the request of the defense attorney.

01:30 PM Defendant, Montreill A. Lawhorn, appeared with Attorney Benjamin Schwarz, for Atty Michelle M. Knapp.
Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Karen Howell.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Bench warrant canceled, bond reinstated.
Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Voluntary Appearance set for 6/7/2022 at 1:30 pm at the request of Atty Knapp.  DA notified.

09:09 AM Attorney Michelle M. Knapp appeared for the Defendant. Defendant Montreill A. Lawhorn not in court.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
No appearance by defendant.
Court authorizes a bench warrant with a $1000 cash bond and forfeits defendant's $700 cash bond.
All STAYED until 6/10/2022 at 5:00 pm.

Defendant, Montreill A. Lawhorn, appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
